title: Untitled.png
description:
Calling for all intrepid testers
Ubuntu Budgie has been working with the creator of the global app-menu (https://github.com/rilian-la-te/vala-panel-appmenu) and we are pleased to have a test PPA with the combined Ubuntu Budgie & Konstantin work in it.

We need you to help out testing please (17.04 only for the moment) - so if you are not afraid of breaking stuff - this is for you.

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntubudgie-dev/global-menu-test
sudo apt update && sudo apt dist-upgrade
sudo apt install budgie-appmenu-applet

logout and login and add via Raven - Panel "Show menus from windows"

Just for good measure - you can see I have also added budgie-pixel-saver-applet and configured it (via Raven - applet settings) to show just the window controls.

Let us know your thoughts - any real issues please drop by our Gitter community room.

Obviously - no menus will be shown for CSD based apps. GTK+2 apps don't work also (e.g. hexchat) - but GTK+3 apps and others like libreoffice (shown) look ok.

remember to ppa-purge the PPA afterwards to return your desktop back to the supported packageset.

sudo ppa-purge ppa:ubuntubudgie-dev/global-menu-test

cheers

David
comments.comment:
seems to be progressing really nicely. the app menu and other widget menus are not playing nice with global menu. if there was a way to blacklist certain processes, like the menus I think that would help. ; +James M not quite following what you are saying. Which widget or apps or processes are you referring to here?; +david mohammed the main application menu or any other widget menu that has a popup you click will halt for awhile (sound volume, user session menu, etc).
if I do not have another app running it will halt indefinitely. but a workaround is to alt+tab multiple times (if I have more than 1 app running) and then the menu you click will then open.
I was using this on ubuntu 17.04, I installed budgie through the budgie remix ppa.
; +James M please raise an issue here - thanks https://github.com/rilian-la-te/vala-panel-appmenu/issues; looks like someone already raised a similar issue, i will add my information to it.
https://github.com/rilian-la-te/vala-panel-appmenu/issues/76; +James M various fixes upstream as been made - has now been uploaded to the test PPA. hopefully will work better now.; it works fantastic, great work :); Will any of these applets still work when Budgie switches to Qt? If not, will they be easy to port?; Too early to say - the plugin API for budgie-desktop 11 has yet to be defined
; +david mohammed I don't think they are going to be the same. At least that's the way I took it over their IRC channel. I'm thinking it's going to be a new and simpler API. ; Hey, it works! For LibreOffice, for QtCreator. Well done! You can't imagine my happiness.; Hmm... Still freezes occasionally on session start and when starting new apps.
